Happy Birthday Mummy!

Dear Mother,

I know you wanted a card but I decided this year to do something different and save myself 99p and a stamp. Those stamp costs can really creep up on you yano.

Nope, this year I decided to actually do something. It's too easy for me to go to the nearest shop and buy you a card that probably smells funny and looks like crap. Instead I built you this page.

Sure it's pretty simple, but according to a popular law coined by some unknown technical vagabond, mothers these days spend on average 128 minutes a day on their phones primarily browsing other peoples social lives on Facebook and feeding hoarding habits on ebay.

Now I don't know this guy personally, but if this law applies to you then I hope this page at least makes you open up that browser thingymabob and do something other than buying used toys and stalking your children on the internet.

I'm only joking with you mother. Can you imagine me reading this to you? This would be a shit monologue wouldn't it. Anyway I guess I should actually get to the point.

Happy Birthday Mother!!

I know I won't be there in person but I'll be thinking of you. Enjoy it, and remember, you only turn 50 once.

Wait, your not 50?! My bad.

Anyway, I love you lots and enjoy your day.
